intro: Sphenodesme racemosa var. sabahensis, commonly known as the Sabah racemose sphenodesme, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests.
